review_title: Shepherd Center is a wonderful place to work!
pros:
My number one reason for working at Shepherd is our patients; they are incredible people, totally inspiring. After experiencing catastrophic, life changing injuries and illnesses they rise and not only do they accomplish great things, they inspire the rest of us who are lucky enough to work with them. Pictures of them are all around the hospital. I love that.
Shepherd has your back. They are so supportive I was even able to work during my cancer treatment. Shepherd also kept us safe during Covid, updating us daily and providing the proper PPE. Shepherd uplifts and motivates employees. They respond immediately/effectively to address needs as they arise. They support us in so many ways.
At Shepherd we work as a team. My coworkers are definitely the best in the business and always step in to help each other get the job done . It's a great feeling to know if you have to call a code, you will have an immediate and smooth response. Patient safety is our top priority.
There are so many reasons I love working at Shepherd. As a mom, the Shepherd story touches my heart. We value our patients knowing they are sons and daughters, mothers and fathers, and we want them to have the same care we would want our own kids to have. 
Shepherd care is state of the art so we are constantly learning.
I especially love the culture at Shepherd. Smiles and friendly greetings are the norm.
cons: Sometimes work doesn't fit into an 8 hour day.

pros: Shepherd prioritizes providing exceptional therapy services for their patients; therapists are provided with numerous opportunities for continuing education, mentorship, and co-treats within and between therapy disciplines. Therapy supervisors work closely with their staff, including scheduled rounding sessions in addition to quarterly goal setting meetings to promote continual growth and development. There is an optional professional enrichment program which encourages growth in clinical skills as well as the ability to work on department- or facility-wide programming and projects, with increasing continuing education money offered at each level. On-boarding and orientation was appropriately paced, and because of the extent of skilled therapists working at Shepherd I always feel like I have resources around me to reach out for help whenever it’s needed.
cons: As a model care center, Shepherd admits some of the most medically complex patients; these patients, their families and complicated discharge plans can be very emotionally challenging to work with.

job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Atlanta, GA
pros: Health Insurance, PDO, Set schedule
cons:
Management is dismissive of PCT's/Nurses in regards to hands on patient care. Work harder not smarter seems to be the current motto. 
Pay is not up to par with the cost of living for nurses or techs. Especially PCTs.

review_title: Easily the best place I've ever worked!
pros: The title says it all! Shepherd is a welcoming place and even though patients here are going through some of the most trying times of their lives, the mood is upbeat and hopeful. Management is both responsive and proactive. For example, they conduct a yearly employee satisfaction survey and truly consult it in making changes to benefit their employees. They are excellent at communicating the direction of the company and have provided clear guidance during the pandemic. Shepherd really values its employees and routinely demonstrates that in bonuses and fun events. Just this past year, they took the initiative to reevaluate the compensation for positions at every level and most saw a modest increase. Beyond its life-transforming mission, Shepherd Center is a employer that is constantly brainstorming for ways to increase employee satisfaction even further and I wouldn't want to work anywhere else!
cons: Have yet to find any!

pros: The company takes care of its employees. There is room for growth.
cons: More competitive wages for nursing staff.

pros: good benefit, good match 403b and PDO
cons: pay average low and merit 3% as maximum each year

review_title: Great for Patients/Clients, Not so Much for Employees
job_title: Volunteer Services Coordinator in Atlanta, GA
pros: Helping patients/clients/volunteers. Seeing patients improve. Connections with patients. Any and all things related to the patient improving, healing, becoming independent... Therapy techniques, creative methods for therapy, recreational ideas for patients/clients.
cons: Lack of diversity, equity and inclusion. Low paying for any and all staff unless you're a Senior Management representative and/or a white employee. Minorities are paid properly or even given more opportunities to advance. Corporate culture needs help as it only cares about its reputation in the public and not actually doing what's right for its staff.

pros: You can pick a set flexible schedule in this department. WFH is offered with many positions. Pay is competitive. Lots of perks through out the year.

pros: Excellent Benefits. Inclusion and Diversity. Friendly Environment. Great Co-Workers. Senior Management is super!!!

pros: Center wide, I quickly became aware of the strong work ethics and quality of care that matched my own standards perfectly. The level of commitment from all of staff makes the work environment very pleasurable. Knowing that all staff members can be counted on any given day makes me confident in my abilities to help provide the highest quality of care. Shepherd Center really cares about it's employees and there is no shortage of making sure you and your work is recognized. Often times we are shown just how much our work is appreciated by the center catering lunches for us, given tickets to see local professional sporting events, and hand written cards from our leadership.
cons: No real cons to the work environment. I recommend making sure you give yourself the opportunity to take time off as needed. It is always encouraged around here.

pros: Amazing mentorship, flexibility, support, and life-long learning

pros: Most of the patients are warm and friendly. Amazing CEO. Great work is done at Shepherd Center. Awesome rehabilitation facility.

review_title: Rewarding and fulfilling career in Healthcare.
pros: Patient centered care approach and offers competitive care.
cons: Specializes in brain and spinal cord injury.

pros:
*a culture of mentorship, education, and professional development
*passionate co-workers
*humor is valued
*no furloughs or pay reductions during COVID even with departmental shut downs
cons: *not much opportunity for merit-based, experienced-based promotion in a title, role, or pay sense.

pros:
I have worked at Shepherd Center for 3 years now and this opportunity has truly been a life-changing experience. I am so thankful for the opportunity to work for a hospital that cares so much about both its patients and its employees. 

The ability to work together as a team to provide holistic patient care is the essence of Shepherd Center, and the interdisciplinary collaboration with other professionals is unparalleled. 
I am a speech-language pathologist in the brain injury Day Program at Shepherd Pathways. I share a caseload with a team consisting of OT, PT, Rec T, nursing, and counseling. The patients seen at Shepherd Center are highly complex, and working closely with my teammates allows me to understand my patient’s needs across multiple domains (i.e., physical, cognitive, psychological, medical). The ability to constantly communicate with my team members ensures no patient needs are left unaddressed. Developing an understanding of my teammates’ roles in the rehabilitation process has also helped me grow tremendously as a clinician. I have been given the unique opportunity to learn how to safely incorporate strategies and goals of other disciplines into my speech therapy treatment. 

Not only does the team mentality at Shepherd Center benefit the patients, it also provides me with a true “family” at work. Shepherd has created a very supportive work environment that allows for true relationships to develop. We provide the same support for each other as we do for our patients. In any setting, there are always going to be people who are your “superiors,” but at Shepherd we value each person’s role equally. I feel supported and heard by my management team who are always reaching out to make sure I feel like I have the tools to do my job successfully.

Shepherd Center also provides their staff members with a great opportunity to keep growing in their field. My fellow “speechies” are always available for bouncing ideas off of each other, and we each grow from the knowledge and expertise provided by the other. We participate in a lot of informal chats as well as structured workgroups to further progress our skills. 

We are also provided with a generous amount of continuing education money to dedicate towards courses we find the most valuable and beneficial towards professional growth. The amount of resources available also provides me with every opportunity to provide my patient with the most up to date care based on evidence based practice. Each care plan can be uniquely tailored to meet my patient’s needs secondary to the variety of resources given to me. 

Overall, Shepherd provides a workplace where I feel valued, supported, heard, encouraged, and fulfilled!
cons: There are no specific cons for working at Shepherd Center. I do recommend having a good outlet for stress and emotions so you can maintain composure for your patients during their time of need.

pros: It is a positive place for patients
cons: poor management system from top-down

job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Atlanta, GA

cons: nothing bad to say so far

pros: There are wonderful programs that benefit the patients as well as the families. The hospital staff work well together as a team and for the most part it is a friendly place to work.
cons: Management is often the cause of a lot of tension in the work place due to inadequate communication skills with the staff. The miscommunication ranges from contributing unwarranted input on patients they are not familiar with to sweeping obvious staff retention issues under the rug. There is also an air of mistrust that causes a lot of perception problems and often forced resignation or termination of a staff member which increases the staff retention issue - it's a vicious cycle that upper management is hopefully taking note of in their assessment of the hospital's programs.

pros: Great atmosphere. People genuinely care for patients
cons: Hard to move up. Great that people want to stay here, but that makes it hard for newcomers to move through the ranks

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Atlanta, GA
pros: Pay, benefits, PTO, easy parking, and has a family feeling.
cons: I can’t think of any.

pros: Great hospital and co workes
cons: Not much to complain about

pros: Great Coworkers Easily able to switch positions

review_title: Great Environment for patients and families
pros: Shepherd Provides a great environment for patients and family members.
cons: Shepherd center could work on nursing management amongst some of the floors.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Atlanta, GA
pros: Compassionate and hard working staff, excellent facility for brain/spinal cord injury rehab, great benefits, great teamwork
cons:
We are not being heard when suggestions are made. The turnover in the last two years should raise a red flag. They pick and choose who they listen to and take advice from. 
The loyal staff that have remained are taken for granted in all areas of the hospital. A large majority of staff are currently looking for other jobs. I'm not sure what changed two years ago but Shepherd has gone downhill in regards to their staff. Happy staff=happy customers. We work hard and more often than not the we will go above and beyond. 
We put ourselves in their shoes.

review_title: I've been at Shepherd since I was a new graduate RN and have enjoyed the education experiences it has brought me.
job_title: RN, BSN, CRRN in Atlanta, GA
pros: The staff here truly love the care they provide to the patients, really relationships are formed between family members, nurse, and PCT's alike. It's a blessing to see some of the miraculous recoveries that happen at Shepherd. And even if a patient's diagnosis causes them not to recover fully, the teamwork, education, and care provided to the caregivers of those patients is awe inspiring to be a part of. The support systems that are built at Shepherd extend beyond its doors even to patients and caregivers after they have graduated from their rehab program and continue along their road to recovery. The Shepherd Center is a gold mine of resources, love, and support for its staff and it's patients. I highly recommend a job at Shepherd if you are looking for a place to learn and grow as a professional and also if you are looking for a job that you will look forward to going to.
cons:
The middle management needs to have more trust in its employees and have better communication with ALL shifts; however, I do feel that large steps are being made to close this gap. 

Complaints are listened to and addressed efficiently.

job_title: Certified Clinical Medical Assistant in Atlanta, GA
pros: Honestly, it's difficult to pick what the best things are about being part of the Shepherd Center family. The first thing that comes to mind is the genuine warmth i feel here each and every day. Everyone is always smiling or cordial with one another and it isn't in a forced way. Another great thing would be the population we care for. The work is so rewarding being able to help life be a little easier for those with brain and spinal cord injuries. Another benefit of working at the Shepherd Center is that, as an employee, I feel I matter, my opinions matter, and that I am genuinely cared for. I could go on and on about the joys of working here but I won't bore you!
cons:
The downsides of working at Shepherd Center are few and very far between. For the sake of putting some, I'll try my best. 
One con would be that the hospital is located on a busy road so if you're in a personal vehicle you may experience some difficulty coming into work if running late.

review_title: Phenomenal & Extremely Rewarding Place to Work
job_title: Chief Compliance Officer & General Counsel in Atlanta, GA
pros:
1.  Regardless of your job/position within the Organization, everyone has the ability to engage with patients and their families.  In fact, everyone is strongly encouraged to interact with patients/families. 
2.  I am a non-clinician, but I feel as though I make a difference to our patients/families due to the interaction described above.
3.  In a variety of ways, Shepherd Center is extremely supportive of its employees having fun and interacting with one another, whether that's the Annual Field Day or a simple ice cream social in our marvelous cafeteria.
4.  Senior Management, and especially the President/CEO, make a concerted effort to remain engaged with ALL employees.  When constructive criticism is offered up, action items are created and then action is taken when practically feasible.
5.  Every single day at Shepherd Center is a great day.
cons: The only con that I can identify is that I didn't start working here sooner....no kidding folks, this is a dream job.

pros: Wonderful place to work for - you know that your time and effort really makes a difference. The patients and their progress make you want to come in everyday. The founders of the hospital are in every day and they are very active and passionate about Shepherd.
cons: Management is lacking. Donor dollars should go back to the hospital and not into management's pockets (vacations, expensive lunches, extravagent spending, etc.)… management should not bully employees. Harassment training should be mandatory for all employees, especially managers.

review_title: Meaningful work. Exceptional people to work with. Reminders of human resiliency everywhere.
pros: Meaningful work. Exceptional, supportive, and authentically kind people to work with. Incomparably good benefits. Reminders of human strength, character, resiliency, and the elevating + healing power of positively directed  unity is everywhere.
cons:
work output + work quality to compensation for work ratio is lacking
… makes it difficult, at times, to rationalize working for less than avg./warranted pay when opportunities to get compensated more accordingly are available. … If committed to Shepherd's vision and all it serves + stands for though, you remember the non-monetary rewards of working for and with Shepherd Center and its patients. … Those (the impact of your work, the quality of staff/colleague interaction, and the consistent, united commitment to core values & culture) far outweigh any dollar sign deficit.
… also, Shepherd's a *Not-for-Profit* Hospital

review_title: My experience of 17 years of working at Shepherd Center
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Atlanta, GA
pros: Shepherd Center gives the opportunity to grow. I have started as an Outpatient Access Specialist. While I was working at that Department, I was able to go back to College under a Shepherd Scholarship. I got my certification as a Health Care Interpreter. I worked there for 3 years then I saw the opportunity to move up and learn more at the Research Department. I had the opportunity to coordinate my first clinical trial and thanks to you all the support that I received that study was overall a success. I have reached 17 years working at Shepherd, and I am planning to continue giving the best of me to our patients, my coworkers, and the Center.
cons: Any Cons to say about Shepherd.

pros: Shepherd Center is highly competitive in salary and benefits.  Great model for a company- almost unrealistic for both employees and patients.  Sets unrealistic expectations when you have to leave!  Family atmosphere, great leadership, good communication.  Great working environment. Only hospital I've ever worked at that gave all employees a bonus!
cons: Location, if you live OTP- traffic is hard.  Days off accrue, rather than getting them all at once, like at the beginning of the year.  They are meeting heavy- way too many meetings- about everything. Doctors can be hard to work with sometimes- some are better than others.

review_title: A great opportunity that crashed to a shocking end
job_title: Patient Access Team Lead in Atlanta, GA
pros: A comfortable atmosphere with friendly co-workers
cons: The Shepherd's, Management and HR does not truly value it's employees and the heart and soul they put into their positions, nor do they stand up for them in situations that end up being nothing but "finger-pointing" from an upset client. They assume the worse and don't even look back once their decisions in haste end up ruining a person and their family.

pros: Management cares about employees.  I've worked a lot of places and never had supervisors that seemed to care so much about me as a person.  Next to the patients, the employees seem to be the most important thing here.  Staffing ratios are MUCH better than other hospitals.
cons: Just like every other hospital I've worked at, the patients seem to be getting sicker every year.  At least here, I usually have enough time to take care of my patients.

pros: Shepherd not only creates a place of hope and warmth for patients and families, but also provides a home for their employees and staff to grow. The positive environment, ongoing team approach, and ultimate goal to put patients and families first were the first things I noticed when I started my career here. I have yet to meet an employee who is not wholeheartedly invested in their role and I believe that the "Shepherd culture" has much to do with that. It is a great thing to be able to be a part of such remarkable recoveries while surrounded by others who share the same passion.  It is THE place to be!
cons: I have yet to experience any downfalls.

review_title: It is an honor to work here
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Atlanta, GA
pros: Set scheduling is a huge bonus. I work the same schedule every week. Shepherd invests in continuity of care and we work as a team, it gives RNs and PCTs to get to know their patients and troubleshoot problems together. PCT’s are highly trained. They are deeply integrated with the patients rehab process as well. Management does its best to keep ratios low so we can provide the best care. Our culture is relaxed but dedicated to the mission of rebuilding lives after a catastrophic injury.
cons: Working with patients with catastrophic injuries can be draining emotionally. Because we are a small hospital, promotion and growth opportunities are sporadic.

pros: The Staff was awesome, except for the management!
cons: I had a few tragedies happen while employed there. My brother shot him self in the head and I missed some days to be there for my family! Then I developed an allergic reaction to a medication right before my shift and was fired on the spot. At the the time upper management was promoting compassion burnout and telling management that they needed to limit compassion for employees calling out to work. My situation deserved compassion and I did not deserve to be fired.

pros: Shepherd Center puts a lot of time and effort into training their therapists to live up to the reputation. There are many benefits and the upper management takes time to make staff feel appreciated.
cons: I do not have any real cons to mention. I have worked there 5 years and have had an incredible experience. Their pay rates may be average but the experience of working in such an encouraging place makes up for it.

pros: Shepherd Center is true to its mission, to provide the best care for people with catastrophic injuries. Employee benefits are excellent. Salaries are competitive. I never felt pressured to overwork; there was work life balance. I had three different supervisors over the years and all treated me like a respected professional. There is a sense of community among the employees and senior management has always been invested in employee satisfaction.
cons: Limited opportunities for growth in some areas.  Extremely rewarding, but emotionally challenging work that can lead to burnout.

pros: Being ranked among the top 10 Rehabilitation hospitals, Shepherd Center has a welcoming environment, renowned therapists, educated staff members, and so much more! After being at Shepherd Center for a year, I've transitioned from volunteer, to PRN, and finally, full-time. There are endless disciplines to learn and progress in providing quality care as well as personal growth and multiple opportunities to progress in your career.
cons: Since Shepherd Center is located in Metro Atlanta, your commute will be longer during rush hour traffic.

pros: Excellent company with an excellent benefits package. Also new HR team are progessive thinkers, which will help the company grow in a positive direction.
cons: No room for growth potential in administrative careers. Not enough cultural diversity in senior management team. Lots of favoritism, which makes it hard to advance.

review_title: Overall, it's been a good place to work.
pros: Salaries are decent. Upper management is very approachable, even the CEO. I have been treated fairly. Advancement opportunities are fair.
cons: Not fond of the insurance (medical coverage). It seems slanted toward the younger employees. The average nurse is in his or her 40's. They need to re-evaluate the coverage. The dental coverage has been really good this year.

pros: Flexible work schedule is the only real perk.  The management is full of nice people but nice people dont always make the best managers.
cons: Pay, working environment, lack of respect for IT employees, there is zero room for growth or vertical movement for any IT pros.

pros: Wonderul place to work, teamwork, feel appreciated, weekly update emails from director of nursing, pay is far better than others, always available shifts to pick up, very enthusiastic workforce and very rewarding
cons: Very Very rarely, like 2 times a yr, you may end up with 7 patients if there is a scheduling issues. Mostly 5-6 pt load. But- everybody, including charge nurses help out.

review_title: One of the best places I've ever worked!

pros: Shepherd Center is very supportive of their employees. The hiring process is fairly quick compared to other healthcare facilities. The environment is positive and uplifting. I like working here because it gives me an opportunity to build a relationship with both my patients and my coworkers.
cons: Schedules are set, but management is pretty good about working with their employees through needed schedule changes.

review_title: It's a great place to work. Best hospital in Georgia

cons: Shepherd is a smaller hospital, so promotion and advancement is a little harder to come by. Other then that, Shepherd is a great place to work

pros: Positive atmosphere, Patient ratio to tech and nurse great. You get to know your patients because you don't have so many.
cons: That I have to go home at the end of the day.

pros: everything about this place is a plus to any employee
cons: this place is great and like anywhere else, it has its moments but overall i enjoy working here

pros: I love working at shepherd center because it’s such a warm and kind atmosphere. Nurse to patient ratios are fair as they can make them. Staff are usually helpful. And our patients are the best!
